title: Chocolate Orange Pancakes
subtitle: Orange pancakes topped with a chocolate drizzle makes the perfect breakfast any holiday season.
subtitle2: These are the fluffiest and lightest pancakes you will ever have! These pancakes are flavored with orange juice and zest and drizzled with a chocolate ganache. A festive twist on a classic breakfast. I make these every Christmas morning!
steps: Combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl.
Make a well in the center and add milk, orange juice, orange zest, cooled melted butter, vanilla, and egg.

Whisk the wet ingredients in the center together before folding them into the dry ingredients. Mix together until smooth (some clumps are totally okay). If the batter is too thick and doesn't pour off the ladle, fold in a couple tablespoons of extra milk into the batter.
Set aside and allow to rest while a pan is heating up on low-medium heat.
Heat a nonstick pan and add a little butter to grease the pan. Pour Â¼ cup of batter onto the pan.
When the underside is golden and bubbles begin to burst on the surface, flip with a spatula and cook until golden.
Repeat until all batter is used up.
For the ganache, place chocolate chips and milk into a microwave safe container.

Microwave in 30 second bursts until all the chocolate is melted. Whisk together until a smooth consistency is reached. Let the drizzle cool down a bit before drizzling on pancakes. If the drizzle is too thick add an additional tbsp of milk until desired consistency is reached.
